item.description:
Description from BoardgameNews

In Agricola, you're a farmer in a wooden shack with your spouse and little else. On a turn, you get to take only two actions, one for you and one for the spouse, from all the possibilities you'll find on a farm: collecting clay, wood, or stone; building fences; and so on. You might think about having kids in order to get more work accomplished, but first you need to expand your house. And what are you going to feed all the little rugrats?

The game supports many levels of complexity, mainly through the use (or non-use) of two of its main types of cards, Minor Improvements and Occupations. In the beginner's version (called the Family Variant in the U.S. release), these cards are not used at all. For advanced play, the U.S. release includes three levels of both types of cards; Basic (E-deck), Interactive (I-deck), and Complex (K-deck), and the rulebook encourages players to experiment with the various decks and mixtures thereof. Aftermarket decks such as the Z-Deck and the L-Deck also exist.

Agricola is a turn-based game. There are 14 game rounds occurring in 6 stages, with a Harvest at the end of each stage (after Rounds 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14).
Each player starts with two playing tokens (farmer and spouse) and thus can take two turns, or actions, per round. There are multiple options, and while the game progresses, you'll have more and more: first thing in a round, a new action card is flipped over.
Problem: Each action can be taken by only one player each round, so it's important to do some things with high preference.
Each player also starts with a hand of 7 Occupation cards (of more than 160 total) and 7 Minor Improvement cards (of more than 140 total) that he/she may use during the game if they fit in his/her strategy. Speaking of which, there are countless strategies, some depending on your card hand. Sometimes it's a good choice to stay on course, and sometimes it is better to react to your opponents' actions.

*** EM HOBBY & SUPPLY STORE ***

NEW RETAIL EDITION.

Comments:


Condition Notes:
Still in shrinkwrap.


Shipping Notes:
You are welcome to come to Community Game Night (see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/127654) and pick up your game in person and pay $0.00 for shipping.
Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser&username=RoamDog).

Please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address.

Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this will expedite delivery).


Payment Notes:
Preferred method of payment for all transactions is for me to receive an Amazon gift certificate from you (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8&ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white).


US buyers:
Preferred method of payment for all transactions is for me to receive an Amazon gift certificate from you.

USPS money order is a good second choice. Western Union transfer is also acceptable.

If you (the receiver) elects to not pay extra for insurance (totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages (I cannot remember ever having a problem, but the risk is there).


Non-US buyers:
Gift certificate from Amazon (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8&ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white) and Western Union wire transfer (see www.westernunion.com) are the only acceptable form of payment. Must be in US dollars and you pay any fees.

Non-US buyers--Please also note that the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me. I have no control over this.
Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver's expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me.

**Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment.

I have tuckboxes in high quality paper for organizing the cards in the box, and all stickers have been sprayed with a matte finish, making them look extra nice.

I have a used Agricola for sale! Get it while it's still available. The farmers are starting to rise up against me everytime I play, and so it must go for my family's safety. I wake up in the morning fearing the pitchforks and torches. Please alleviate my nightmares by purchasing a well used Agricola. I will be forever grateful.

What's Included?
- Everything that came with the game. 
- All game pieces, except for one tan family disk. 
- All cards necessary to play with up to 5 players.

What's Used?
- Well, I've played the game. So...everything has been opened. 
- One of the corners on the box has been damaged. Kids...they like to sit inside and on top of boxes.
- The instructions have a rip through part of them. Kids...they don't know how to turn pages.
- The paper included to record the various points needed to win has been reduced to just a few pieces left. Kids...they just draw on whatever they can.

---------
Will accept payment via PayPal or the Cash App only.

------

[b][size=14]all of those items are English*[/size][/b](except where no English version exists) and in very good condition, some actually never made it to the table. The [b]original boxes[/b] are available** for some of the decks if you wanted them. 
* [b]That makes a huge difference value to some of those items.[/b]
** If you need to know, just ask. You can have them if you want them, of course.

Buy it Now: Â£270

Yes, that might seem a lot - but - some of those English decks are nowadays rare and consequently expensive, as being small they can be readily shipped across the world .

[b]Bonus[/b]: Comes with a bespoke professionally printed and spiral bound copy of The Unofficial Agricola Compendium V9.0 covering all the cards that were then extant around December 2010, including e.g. the WM & G decks as well.

Including stickers for the family members.
